_header: I love and I dare not
_description: Contrasts: eight monorhyming lines in two sets of semi-proverbial aphorisms, one leading to frustration and the other to achievement

PierpontB21.First Lines:
I loue and y dare noutȝty þenke and y sey
                    nouȝt…
PierpontB21.Last Lines:
…And be meke & stylleand þu shalt haue all þy
                    wylle
PierpontB21.Note:
Six lines all ending ‘nouȝt’ plus one couplet at end;
                    written two lines of verse per line of MS.
PierpontB21.Editions:
Bühler,  Kurt. 
             “A Middle English Medical Manuscript from Norwich.” 
             Studies in Medieval Literature in Honor of Professor Albert Cross
                Baugh.
            MacEdward Leach, ed. 
         Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 1961: 285-98: 286.
